p: MAPK (Mitogen-activated protein kinases) are a particular class of serine/threonine protein kinases which are activated by various stresses such as salt, drought, cold etc. We observed the up-regulation of similar proteins i.e . protein phosphatase 2C ( Urochondra_DN30190_c0_g2_i2), and Serine/threonine-protein kinase 10 ( Urochondra_DN34126_c1_g1_i6) at high salinity i.e. ECe 30 dS/m, 40 dS/m and 50 dS/m (Supplementary file S4). Similarly, Copper-transporting ATPase RAN1 ( Urochondra_DN38546_c0_g1_i1) which involved in MAP kinase pathway was also found to be up-regulated.
